channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Telephone boxes filled with rubbish potential fire hazard, 10th October
item.description:
The unused and neglected telephone boxes along Greenwich High Road before joining Greenwich Church Street have become a dumping place. Its a potential fire risk if cigarettes or vapes are thrown in. Could also be targeted by arsonists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roan Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown lbb trees, 10th October
item.description:
Are you waiting for bad weather this autumn or winter to cause the 3 enormous LBB unmaintained trees to hurt someone or the property they are next to? You NEVER maintain them. You allow them to grow out of control. They nearly touch our roof. They hang their huge branches over our garden. The birds poo is endless. The branches are huge. The sap is ridiculous. The trees roots are in my garden. I will add this to the fix my street site every week until you bother to maintenance your trees. We pay hefty council tax and where is it being spent? Only on your wages. Certainly not your trees. Dogs foul on the green non stop, you never clean it up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Imperial Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
